solution_line_template: The number that left the camp on Saturday morning was {hours_left}*{rate_left} = <<{hours_left}*{rate_left}={num_left}>>{num_left} athletes
This means that in the camp there remained {initial_athletes}-{num_left} = <<{initial_athletes}-{num_left}={remaining_after_left}>>{remaining_after_left} athletes.
The new group trickling in on Sunday morning comprised {hours_in}*{rate_in} = <<{hours_in}*{rate_in}={num_in}>>{num_in} athletes
The number that slept at the camp on Sunday night is therefore {remaining_after_left} + {num_in} = <<{remaining_after_left}+{num_in}={sunday_night_athletes}>>{sunday_night_athletes} athletes

Since there were {initial_athletes} athletes on Saturday night, the difference is {initial_athletes} - {sunday_night_athletes} = <<{initial_athletes}-{sunday_night_athletes}={difference}>>{difference} athletes.
